intro: Spermacoce lavandulifolia, commonly known as purple rattlebox, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, a characteristic feature of the genus Spermacoce. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
